intro: Tithymalus teheranicus, commonly known as the Persian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun exposure. Tithymalus teheranicus is often found in rocky or limestone-rich habitats, making it a distinctive feature of its native landscape.
